title: Vegan Slow Cooking for Two or Just for You (gnv64)
description:
Vegan Slow Cooking for Two or Just for You: More than 100 Delicious One-Pot Meals for Your 1.5-Quart/Litre Slow Cooker 
by Kathy Hester and Kate Lewis
Fair Winds Press | August 2013 | ISBN-10: 1592335632 | ePUB | 101 pages | 39.3 mb

If you have a small family or are looking for better-portioned vegan meals (that donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t force you to eat chili for a week straight!), Vegan Slow Cooking for Two or Just for You is the perfect resource for you. Featuring recipes geared specifically for use with a 1.5- to 2-quart slow cooker, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll find endless meal ideas that you can make with minimal effort and maximum taste. Just prep a few items the night before or morning of, and come home to a hot mealÃ¢â‚¬â€or side, or dessertÃ¢â‚¬â€the moment you walk in the door!
The little slow cooker is so easy to use that it makes cooking everyday a snap, so you can have a healthy variety of foods at a fraction of the cost of eating out. Inside, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll find a whole new world of food to fall in love with, from breakfast-y Pumpkin Polenta to comforting White Bean Quinoa Gumbo to luscious Blueberry Lemon Cake. YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be amazed at what your little slow cooker can do!

About the Authors
Kathy Hester, author of the bestselling cookbook The Vegan Slow Cooker and the upcoming The Great Vegan Bean Book, enjoys spreading the word about how easy it is to make tasty vegan food.
 She writes HealthySlowCooking.com, is the vegan blogger for Key Ingredient (http://www.keyingredient.com/blog/bloggers/kathy-hester), and writes for various publications, including the vegan magazine Chickpea. She also teaches vegan cooking classes. She lives in Durham, NC. Visit her at www.HealthySlowCooking.com
Kate Lewis is an Ohio-based food, lifestyle and portrait photographer whose work brings her to multicultural, sophisticated and vibrant cities like New York, LA, Montreal and beyond. Kate is also a sought after vegan food stylist and has worked on prominent projects with authors such as Christy Morgan, Isa Chandra Moskowitz, Kathy Hester and Terry Hope Romero. With a passport in hand, she is ready to travel to wherever her skills are needed. Also, found in her repertoire are prop styling and art direction, which comes in handy when working with a small crew.
You can find out more about Kate's day to day adventures on her blog LeChouSauvage.com
